name: Adobong Sitaw
description: Adobong Sitaw offers a healthy twist on a traditional Filipino favorite, ideal for those on a low-carb, low-sugar diet but who don't mind a bit of a sodium kick. This dish is perfect for anyone looking to enjoy classic flavors in a healthified way.

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the fresh string beans by trimming the ends and cutting them into 2-inch lengths.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: In a pan, heat a tablespoon of oil over medium heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Add the prepared string beans to the pan and saut√© for about 5 minutes, or until they start to soften.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Season the string beans with soy sauce, ground black pepper, and salt. Stir well to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Continue to cook the string beans for another 5 minutes until they are fully cooked and the flavors are well blended.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5
